column8: Barisan Nasional strategic communications deputy director Datuk Eric See-To has asked DAP to explain how the Registrar of Societies (RoS) directive for it to hold fresh central executive committee elections is tantamount to “sabotage”.See-To noted that with the general election held every five years, the fifth anniversary of the last one would be May 5, 2018.“How is it sabotage when you still have nine months before the fifth anniversary of GE13?” he said in a statement on Tuesday.The 14th General Election must be held before Aug 24, 2018.On July 7, RoS director-general Datuk Mohammad Razin Abdullah said DAP must hold fresh elections for its central executive committee (CEC).The Opposition party has criticised the decision, saying that this would scuttle its chances of being ready to compete in the 14th general election (GE14), and described the decision as being politically-motivated.However, See-To said that DAP held its CEC elections in December, 2012, about two and a half months before the fifth anniversary of GE12, which was held on March 8, 2008.“It is now early July 2017, which is nine months before early May 2018, the fifth anniversary of GE13,” he said. GE13 was held on May 5, 2013.Prior to GE13, DAP held its CEC elections in December, 2012, only about two and a half months before the fifth anniversary of GE12.“It is now early July 2017, which is nine months before early May 2018, the fifth anniversary of GE13,” he added.See-To challenged DAP CEC member Gobind Singh Deo to explain how the RoS is sabotaging DAP's general election preparations.In its July 7 statement, the RoS said its decision was made following complaints lodged by DAP members themselves.RoS also deemed that the re-election in 2013 was not carried out, based on the list of delegates authorised to attend and vote in the earlier polls held on Dec 15, 2012.If DAP does not abide by the RoS’ instruction, the party would not be able to nominate candidates to contest in GE14.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...y3QzXMZTPctv.99
